Masks went voluntary in my part of Europe but my class continued to mask after I explained the extra risks of covid to myself and bubs as I was pregnant.

@Record_Factory Last week I managed 4 covid tests in seven days - 2 for school (rapid at home and rapid at clinic) and 2 for visiting Israel (One rapid, PCR). Longest I waited was for my PCR on entry to Israel which was 8 hours. On the Sabbath.

@lancewiggs @gnat I arrived in Israel this past weekend. Needed to supply my vaccine card and address for isolation. within minutes I had my covid qr and paperwork for entry. I rapid tested 24 hours before boarding and then on arrival at airport with PCR. Those results were released with 9 hours

@BusinessGamesAI @DrJinRussell @ellenstrickland I‚Äôve been dealing with covid in Europe so a very different beast. We‚Äôve had rolling stoppages but it does mean schools need to avoid indoor mixing of kids. We don‚Äôt let the kids leave their bags in corridors to avoid this risk.

@DrJinRussell @ellenstrickland @BusinessGamesAI At the moment Covid protocols are -at home test mid week, clinic test on Sunday, class shut for five days for a case and retest to come back, air filters and I keep my windows all day. Surgical/kn 95 masks are on all day except when eating. Regular hand sanitising.
